title: update config
content: its obvious that the last version of FF has setting issues. Something new in the config settings is preventing css mods from taking place. I know about the toolkit css item etc.... but there is something else that is not right. Maybe you should check with Apple before you release updates. Please find out what is is..you might have to talk to Apple and try different things on a Mac ....to confirm that css works.. I am running the latest.. I think its definitely a FF thing because it worked before and other fonts controlled by Mac are not having the problems that the bookmarks toolbar is having regarding css to enlarge the microscopic font that in on a Mac toolbar. If you cant find anything then I guess its time to go to Brave.
creator: wb9591

title: I won't check a box that pre-agrees to being in "studies" I'm not aware of...but...
content:
I won't check a box that opts me into observational and INTERVENTIONAL studies that I won't even be aware that I'm in since I don't look every 5 minutes at the settings and may do things like the evil sort of one fb ? did that changed your emotions.

That's a great example of why I moved to Firefox from Chrome and am wary of Facebook.

I'd be more than happy to check a box that says: "Please offer me any/all studies I may be eligible for including add'l questions to see if I'm eligible, with a reasonable stab at assent (not even informed consent). And of course whether data is anonymous (truly, as in after the study even if you wanted to you couldn't figure out which person was which), or not. Not anonymous may be fine....depending on the study. My very best, really, you're great....AND I'd be happy to discuss, advise (see below)...my 'toolbox' isn't simply biomedical. Darren

(Just me being pedantic now ignore this as you wish: And you say "study" ... I'm a researcher (sometimes)...IRB, grants, peer review, publications. Research is the "creation of generalizable knowledge." Is that what you're doing? I suspect you're doing more "quality improvement" where you figure out what works better for you...and SOMETIMES that is generalizeable knowledge (i.e., certain colors make people happy in every browser not Firefox specific), but do you publish it as peer reviewed research? Now, it's TOTALLY FINE if you don't and it's QI....but would specify that and not call it studies...call it...evaluating improvements or whatever. The use of the word 'study' and 'research' drive me nuts since when we talk to people about actual 'studies' and 'research' they conflate that with marketing evaluations of what makes us by more or which candidate we're interested in or how to sell things to us.)

title: Default preferences: How to set default zoom?
content:
I'm wondering how to configure a default zoom level for all users.

I want

about:preferences -> Default zoom

to have a default value of 133% instead of 100%.

So far I'm using the files

firefox/distribution/distribution.ini

and

firefox/browser/defaults/preferences/all-XXX.js

for configuration, but I don't know which keyword to use. I compared the content-prefs.sqlite file between to test profiles, one having 100% default zoom, the other having 133% default zoom.

The database says there is a setting "browser.content.full-zoom", but I can't configure this with the *.ini or *.js file, or can I?


I also read this:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Preferences/A_brief_guide_to_Mozilla_preferences

but it didn't help.

title: I get constant "The connection has timed out" errors... please help.
content:
Hi Folks, I recently had to change my slow POTS broadband to LTE broadband as its quicker, however the LTE connection is quite weak (rural UK), so i get a much faster speed for streaming at night, but sometimes establishing a session or initial connection can be a little troublesome.

Im studying from home all day, every day at present. I get perhaps 40% of my new tabs / web searches sending me a "The connection has timed out" error, which i have to refresh the page to try again. Usually i can live with this, as im used to poor broadband generally.

Problem - i have a timed aptitude test tomorrow. I cant use any other network connection as im not supposed to go anywhere with coronavirus.

Can anyone help me resolve the network timeout problem? Im doing practice tests and im now getting timeouts for the server to have received my answers! I dont want to fail the test because of network timeouts.

MacOS 10.15.4 - firefox browser 76.0.1

Any help would be MASSIVELY appreciated.

title: Barra de favoritos do FireFox
content: fui testar a barra de favoritos, e depois desativei elas, quando eu desativei a barra depois disso ficou grande ainda. e não sei se é um bug e tem como resolver manualmente.
creator: kaua21br

title: hulu.com/activate not loading
content:
Hello,

The site hulu.com/activate does not load. I had to switch to Chrome. Any reason why?
creator: skovrant

title: Passwords
content: Suddenly every time I want to use Outlook, E-bay or Facebook, I have to put in a password even though with Outlook there is a 'save password' box which I have clicked. This is a recent problem. I am using Windows 10. People have suggested clearing cookies and re-starting the computer - both of which I have done without success. Any help welcome but I am a senior with limited computer skills so please make the suggestions simple! Thanks.
creator: Aussiemim

title: Mac Dock & Taskbar disappearing
content: I have an external monitor connected to my Macbook. When I play a youtube video in full screen on my external monitor, as I surf the web using firefox on my Macbook screen, the dock and taskbar disappears on the Macbook's screen. Does anyone know why this is happening? This is midly inconvenient, and does not happen when I use Google Chrome. Thanks.
creator: limjunwei567

title: Sorteo
content: Al abrir firefox me salio que por ser la busqueda 5 mil podria participar en una rifa y ganar un telefono por solo tres dolares, ¿es veridico?
creator: ortegadriana05

title: Firefox at startup question
content: Is there a way to run multiple instances of Firefox at startup? I have it set to run at startup...it opens and loads all my tabs, just like I want. However, I would also like it to open another window as well. Is this even possible?
creator: emailbenton

title: Cliqz/Firefox appending .part to downloads & corrupting files
content: The recent updates of Cliqz and Firefox blocked or corrupted downloaded software updates on my Mac and appended a .part to end of downloaded files, hence Apple installer could not open ANY download. Cliqz was my primary browser and was affected as was Firefox when I made it the primary browser. Only after making Safari the primary browser could I download and open updates to my third party apps and use Apple installer. I would like to know what the recent Cliqz and Firefox updates did to cause this problem, and when the software flaw will be fixed? The .part issues seem to be associated with these two browsers and I don't know why? I initially focused on Comcast but it was not the source of the problem. If anyone has has insight into this issue I would like your comments please.
creator: sternhagenh

title: Firefox Monitor "Artsy Data Breach" email
content: Today May 25, 2020 my wife rec'd email <breach-alerts[at]mozilla.com> from Firefox Monitor warning of a data breach at the Artsy web site. She doesn't use the Artsy web site and doesn't have Firefox installed on her laptop or phone. I Googled for "Firefox Artsy data breach" and did not find a report of a data breach at Artsy. We assume this is a phishing email, but I wanted to check with Mozilla to verify my conclusion. I do use Firefox on my laptop, and I haven't received a similar email. I could forward the email if that would be helpful. Thanks for your help. Ray Wynn [email address]
creator: ray611

title: Set popup windows to open in the background instead of taking focus from the main window.
content: There are some pages where I need popups enabled. However, when the popup opens it takes focus from the main window. How can I set it to open popups in the background and prevent the popup from taking focus?
creator: sheets.d

title: Tôi không nhận được email xác nhận đăng nhập trên ios
content: Tôi không nhận được email xác nhận đăng nhập trên ios
creator: vanhoak2

title: Why does Firefox insist so much on reinstalling unnecessary disabled/uninstalled extensions like Bing?
content:
At every firefox new updates, firefox insists on restoring extensions that I have disabled/uninstalled because they are completely useless to me and I don't want to use. Enforced Useless Extensions: Amazon.com, Amazon.com.au, Bing, Google, Twitter, OpenH264

There is also a common secret: After a new firefox update, I must dig to empty the "features folder" (C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\browser\features) which keeps also Useless "Features" like: Enforced Useless Features: doh-rollout@mozilla.org.xpi, formautofill@mozilla.org.xpi, screenshots@mozilla.org.xpi, webcompat@mozilla.org.xpi, webcompat-reporter@mozilla.org.xpi

So, Why does Firefox insist so much on reinstalling unnecessary, useless disabled/uninstalled extensions and "features"?
creator: adonios77
